name: delamination
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of a material breaking or being broken into thin layers, or an example of this: Any moisture in the material would certainly cause delamination and very expensive damage. These defects, such as bubbles, cracks, and delaminations, are not necessarily visible, even under a microscope. The skipper pulled out of the race to fix delamination problems with the boat.
More examplesFewer examplesThey checked the concrete and found no real evidence of any delamination. This in turn creates a weak spot in the tyre, making it prone to delamination.
